clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Evaluating the Clinical Outcome of a Modified d'Hoore Technique for Laparoscopic Ventral Mesh Rectopexy
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Study Evaluating the Clinical Outcome of a Modified d'Hoore Technique for Laparoscopic Ventral Mesh Rectopexy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this observational study is to evaluate the clinical outcome of a modified d'Hoore technique for laparoscopic ventral mesh rectopexy in patients with primary rectal prolapse, rectocele and/or enterocele.The goal of the study will be achieved by reporting the peri- and postoperative complications ((serious) adverse events), recurrences and re-interventions. Pre-operative to postoperative changes in pain, functional outcome and quality of life will be evaluated as well.

primary_outcome.measure: Procedural efficacy - Number of participants with (serious) adverse events
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with (serious) adverse events ≥ grade II Clavien-Dindo

primary_outcome.measure: Procedural efficacy - Conversion rate to laparotomy during the index procedure
primary_outcome.description: Number of conversions to laparotomy during the index procedure

primary_outcome.measure: Procedural efficacy - Number of participants with (serious) adverse events
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with (serious) adverse events ≥ grade II Clavien-Dindo

secondary_outcome.measure: Pre-operative abdominal pain by means of the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of pre-operative abdominal pain by means of the VAS, which contains a 0 to 100 grading scale with 0 equaling no pain and 100 equaling the worst conceivable pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pre-operative vaginal pain by means of the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of pre-operative vaginal pain by means of the VAS, which contains a 0 to 100 grading scale with 0 equaling no pain and 100 equaling the worst conceivable pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional score - Obstructive Defecation Syndrome (ODS) score
secondary_outcome.description: The ODS score is obtained by means of a structured 8-item questionnaire on multiple bowel symptoms. The cumulative score for all answers ranges from 0 to 31, with higher scores being indicative of more severe symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional score - Cleveland Clinical Incontinence Score (CCIS)
secondary_outcome.description: The CCIS is a 5-item questionnaire used to score the level of fecal incontinence. The cumulative score ranges from 0 to 20, with higher scores being indicative of more severe symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life - Birmingham Bowel and Urinary Symptoms Questionnaire (BBUSQ)
secondary_outcome.description: The BBUSQ is a 22-item questionnaire to record data on 4 domains: constipation, evacuation, incontinence and urinary symptoms. Higher scores are indicative of more severe symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-operative abdominal pain by means of the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of post-operative abdominal pain by means of the VAS, which contains a 0 to 100 grading scale with 0 equaling no pain and 100 equaling the worst conceivable pain.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients eligible for laparoscopic ventral mesh rectopexy
arm_group.description: Female patients with primary rectal prolapse, rectocele and/or enterocele eligible for laparoscopic ventral mesh rectopexy (LVMR)

intervention.description: Ifabond (Péters surgical) is a CE-marked synthetic surgical glue for internal and external use. The glue is non-toxic, biocompatible and biodegradable. It is commercially available and can be used for mesh fixation, as tissue adhesive, for sealing of sutured tissue and for hemostasis.
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients eligible for laparoscopic ventral mesh rectopexy

study_pop.textblock: Female patients with primary rectal prolapse, rectocele and/or enterocele eligible for laparoscopic ventral mesh rectopexy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female patients.
- Patient ≥ 18 years of age at study entry.
- Patient and investigator signed and dated the informed consent form prior to the index-procedure.
- Patient with primary rectal prolapse (grades I to V according to the Oxford scale), rectocele and/or enterocele.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient is unable / unwilling to provide informed consent.
- Patient with recurrent rectal prolapse, rectocele and/or enterocele.
- Patient is unable to comply with the study protocol or proposed follow-up visits.
- Patient has a contra-indication for laparoscopic ventral mesh rectopexy.
